contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox officeholder |image=Yvonne de Gaulle.jpg |office=[[Wife of the President of the French Republic|First Lady of France]] |term_start=8 January 1959 |term_end=28 April 1969 |president=[[Charles de Gaulle]] |predecessor=Germaine Coty |successor=[[Claude Pompidou]] |birth_date={{birth date|1900|5|22|df=y}} |birth_place=[[Calais]], France |death_date={{death date and age|df=y|1979|11|8|1900|5|2}} |death_place=[[Paris]], France |relations= |spouse=[[Charles de Gaulle]] |children= }} '''Yvonne de Gaulle''' (born '''Yvonne Charlotte Anne Marie Vendroux'''; 22 May 1900 – 8 November 1979) was the wife of [[Charles de Gaulle]]. They were married on April 7, 1921. She was sometimes known as "Tante Yvonne" ("Aunt Yvonne"). She is known for the quote, "The presidency is temporary—but the family is permanent." She and her husband narrowly escaped an assassination attempt on August 22, 1962, when their [[Citroën DS]] was targeted by [[machine gun]] fire arranged by [[Jean Bastien-Thiry]] at the [[Clamart|Petit-Clamart]]. The couple had three children: [[Philippe de Gaulle|Philippe]] (b. 1921), Élisabeth (b. 1924), and [[Anne de Gaulle|Anne]] (1928–1948), who was born with [[Down syndrome]]. Yvonne de Gaulle set up a charity, '{{lang|fr|La fondation Anne-de-Gaulle}}', to help children with disabilities.
